noun.description: Chiefly Eng. regional (east.). The act of putting potatoes or other root crops into a pit and covering them with straw or earth. Compare "pie". Now rare.
Originally and chiefly US. The act or practice of throwing a (custard) pie at a person, especially an authority figure.

origin: Late 18th century. From pie + -ing<br>mid 19th century; earliest use found in Daily Ohio Statesman. From pie + -ing.
